body_html:
@shlens Thanks for your Input.

Additionally, what do you think about renaming the current tf.image.per_image_whitening to tf.image.per_batch_whitening? (i.e remove the current tf.image.per_image_whitening).

This would be clean from both API side and also user side perspective. The only disadvantage is, that it breaks compability.

This solution would work even if we use tf.batch_normalization as backend. (i.e. the posted code snippet should to the same as tf.image.per_image_whitening , if it is applied to a single image).
body_text:
@shlens Thanks for your Input.
Additionally, what do you think about renaming the current tf.image.per_image_whitening to tf.image.per_batch_whitening?  (i.e remove the current tf.image.per_image_whitening).
This would be clean from both API side and also user side perspective. The only disadvantage is, that it breaks compability.
This solution would work even if we use tf.batch_normalization as backend. (i.e. the posted code snippet should to the same as tf.image.per_image_whitening , if it is applied to a single image).
body:
@shlens Thanks for your Input.

Additionally, what do you think about renaming the current `tf.image.per_image_whitening` to `tf.image.per_batch_whitening`?  (i.e remove the current `tf.image.per_image_whitening`).

This would be clean from both API side and also user side perspective. The only disadvantage is, that it breaks compability.

This solution would work even if we use `tf.batch_normalization` as backend. (i.e. the posted code snippet should to the same as `tf.image.per_image_whitening` , if it is applied to a single image).
